jobDescription: Responsible for refactoring an application that was created on Apache Camel to Spring Boot
as well as migrated another of legacy APIs.
I also contributed upgrading java's version from 10 to 20 legacy APIs to fix
some vulnerabilities on the old java version, starting from local and development environments
to releasing them to production by using a newer Open JDK version that fixed those vulnerabilities already.
responsibilities: Maintainer and feature crafter of 3 UI repositories; DICOM Viewer, Admin system and Design System.
Create technical designs for new features and troubleshoot complex bugs
Mentor new coworkers on our Management site.
Deliver efficient and quality code with best practices on time.
achievements: Created the first AI powered tool focused on health care to get conclusions of patient's studies.
Created an Agenda product for studies booking in our Management system, that helped a lot of our users easily manage their appointemnts with their patients (Similar to Google Calendar).
A big list of UI components crafted in Eden's UI Design System.

jobDescription: I have been being working with Luxoft for a while, within a great project Expedia.
The initial work was a migration for an old stack with JSP as the main core of the
Expedia pages, to a new progressive web application with React, TypeScript and
Java/Kotlin. Here I haveve contributed in creation of microservices using Kotlin, and
crafting the new homepage UI across different Expedia sites in the world
Worked with a11y, localization and best code practices.
Recognized as a Core Approver member team for the main domain application
across different Expedia brands.
responsibilities: Undertake the migration of Expedia's homepage, transitioning it from an outdated JSP-based stack to React.
Maintain Expedia's homepage web site such as integrating new features or fixing current issues.
An evaluator responsible for reviewing the Core Repository entry page at Expedia.
Generate translations for the different 30+ supported languages.
Curator of the primary UI Toolkit Design System, which serves as the foundational framework for all new user interface implementations across Expedia's diverse brand portfolio.
achievements: Distinguished as a member of the Core Approvers team within the Progressive Web Application (PWA) division, and appointed as an administrator for the primary repository in that capacity.
Engaged in Expedia's mentoring program, providing guidance and mentorship to two software engineers, both of whom subsequently received offers for full-time employment with Expedia.

jobDescription: Neurothink is a Network resource provider startup for Machine Learning and AI by providing
industry-leading compute and virtualization resources in a secure, customizable and automated workflow.
I am in charge of all the Frontend application development phase for delivering to the final user proper access to
Machine Learning virtualization CPUs and GPUs with a variety of different memberships stating from the basic amount
to advanced ones for more robust projets. Using React and Redux for storage, and Django with Python 3 in the backend.
responsibilities: Leading Frontend application which has integrations with Tensorflow and JupiterLab.
Refactor old components with a new enhanced designs.
Integrates payment memberships with Stripe and maintain integration.
Releases to production and its different testing environments.
Deliver high quality code with best practices.
Migrated from an old React version to the newest incrementally.
achievements: Enabled payments on Neurothink with a successfull integration with Stripe.
Refactored old UI to the enhanced one on time for demo with investors.

jobDescription: I started my professional career with Unosquare. I joined the company as an Intern to start developing software for helping
physicians and patients defeat cancer diseases in Foundation Medicine Inc. When the internship has finished,
Unosquare and Foundation Medicine offered me a full time employee position to continue working with them.
I was involved developing web and mobile application focused on JavaScript technologies such as Express.js,
React and React Native.
responsibilities: Develop and deliver a mobile application for parking slot management at Unosquare's headquarters in Guadalajara (GDL) within the initial 6 months of the internship's duration.
Maintainer of FMI's reporting web site and mobile application that processes those reports.
Peer reviews on pull requests on other team members
achievements: Deliver parking slots app project successfully to Unosquare GDL offices.

Acknowledged as the top-performing intern of the cycle 2017-2018 who achieved significant results within the Unosquare Internship program, earning high satisfaction from the client due to outstanding outcomes.
